StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateNonWorkingDays]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@OrgID uniqueidentifier, @RecruiterID uniqueidentifier, @Year int, @Month int, @DayList xml = null
AS BEGIN
-- Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
DELETE FROM [RSSOSS].[USMC].[NonWorkingDay] WHERE Organiza.onId = @OrgID AND RecruiterID = @RecruiterID AND YEAR(Date) = @Year AND MONTH(Date) = @Month
IF @DayList IS NOT null BEGIN DECLARE @DayListTable TABLE (DayStamp varchar(10))
INSERT INTO @DayListTable (DayStamp) SELECT ParamValues.DayStamp.value('.','VARCHAR(10)') FROM @DayList.nodes('DayList/dayStamp') as ParamValues(DayStamp)
INSERT INTO [RSSOSS].[USMC].[NonWorkingDay] ([Organiza.onId] ,[RecruiterID] ,[Date]) SELECT @OrgID ,@RecruiterID ,DayStamp FROM @DayListTable
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
